page.title: 09ROLE OF A PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: {Ashwellthorpe & Fundenhall}are one unit for local government purposes with{598}electors.The Parish Council, all non-political seats, comprises 3 men & 4 women,the youngest aged 41. Meetings are held about 20 times a year for Council,Parish & Planning,at 7.30p.m. in the Village Hall hired at Â£6 a time.{Electors usually attend,} listening attentively to business be- ing transacted.In recent times in a crowded hall{significant battles have {been won to stop the abolition of the {bus services & prevent greyhound {racing. }A 10 acre field "enclosed" in the 18C & owned by the P.C., valued at Â£20,000 with vacant possession, is let at Â£780p.a. which meets P.C. expenses. Expenditure year ended March 31,1985 = Â£789.44; Income = Â£920.67; Current account is Â£40.71; Deposit account is Â£1701.44.
